ssot__ContactPointConsent__dlm.name: Contact Point Consent
ssot__ContactPointConsent__dlm.description: The Contact Point Consent DMO represents the consent details for a specific contact point, including the date, method, duration, and whether the party has double opted-in.

ssot__ConsentCaptureddateTime__c.description: The date and time consent was captured.

ssot__ConsentCapturedSourceName__c.description: The location where consent was captured.

ssot__ConsentStatusId__c.description: A reference ID to consent status.

ssot__ContactPointId__c.description: A reference ID to a contact point.

ssot__Id__c.description: A unique ID that is used as the primary key for the Consent Point Consent DMO.

ssot__DataSourceId__c.description: A reference ID to a logical name for a system that is the source of records identified by an external record ID.

ssot__DataSourceObjectId__c.description: A reference ID for the logical name of the object where the record originated, for example a cloud storage file or another connectorâ€™s external object.

ssot__DataUsePurposeId__c.description: A reference ID to how the data is being used.

ssot__DoubleConsentCapturedateTime__c.description: The data and time a contact consents to receive communication using a double-opt in process.

ssot__EffectiveFromDate__c.description: The date when the consent form is in effect.

ssot__EffectiveToDate__c.description: The date when the consent form is no longer in effect.

ssot__ExternalRecordId__c.description: A reference ID to an external data source system.

ssot__ExternalSourceId__c.description: A reference ID for the system in which the external record ID was assigned.

ssot__InternalOrganizationId__c.description: A reference ID to the business unit or other internal organization that owns the business account.

ssot__Name__c.description: The name of the contact who provided consent.

ssot__PartyId__c.description: A reference ID to the parent party, for example, an individual, business, or affiliation group.

ssot__PartyRoleId__c.description: A reference ID to an associated party role, for example, a customer, supplier, or competitor.
